description.narrative:
Component 1 BWF staff capable in of designing new programs for donors funding BWF staff members increased efficiency in the work and meeting clients requirements Increase visibility of BWF on local market with extended services and area of operation
Component 2 Increased sale and other performance indicators of BWF beneficiaries following assistance in promotion and sale Increased scope of business with local and foreign business partners of BWF beneficiaries due to technical assistance Extended business activity of BFW beneficiaries resulting of 2 rounds of BPC during Component 3 Obstacle affecting SMEs owned by women in business environment changed.

Strengthening the organizational capacity of BWF Support the establishment and growth of women owned SMEs and entrepreneurs. Build capacities and skills of business women & women entrepreneurs to manage an enterprise. Advocating the value of women entrepreneurs in the Palestinian Economy.

The main target groups of this project are going to be women entrepreneurs who are running and managing SMEs, mainly graduated from 2011 & 2013 Business “Plan competition program” and those who are joining the BDC services, and transitioning to formal business. In Addition, women Entrepreneurs who are willing to join the economy through creative ideas all over West Bank with more focus on North and South areas . For the Business Plan Competition: Female graduates, from low income families, from all West Bank, mainly North and South, will be targeted, and have the desire to start their own small businesses due to the lack of job opportunities.

mailing-address.narrative: Business Woman Forum Al Fare Building, 2nd floor, Al Balou RAMALLAH Palestijns Bezette Gebieden
